metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17664 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A Remote Crash issue was discovered in Asterisk Open Source 13.x before 13.18.4, 14.x before 14.7.4, and 15.x before 15.1.4 and Certified Asterisk before 13.13-cert9. Certain compound RTCP packets cause a crash in the RTCP Stack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-17664` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:13.22.0~dfsg-2
asterisk-config - 1:13.22.0~dfsg-2
asterisk-dahdi - 1:13.22.0~dfsg-2
asterisk-mobile - 1:13.22.0~dfsg-2
asterisk-modules - 1:13.22.0~dfsg-2
asterisk-mp3 - 1:13.22.0~dfsg-2
asterisk-mysql - 1:13.22.0~dfsg-2
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:13.22.0~dfsg-2
asterisk-tests - 1:13.22.0~dfsg-2
asterisk-voicemail - 1:13.22.0~dfsg-2
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:13.22.0~dfsg-2
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:13.22.0~dfsg-2
asterisk-vpb - 1:13.22.0~dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:13.22.0~dfsg-2').
